message.content:
Based on the credit specifications and applicant profiles, here's the ranking from most suitable (#1) to least suitable (#4):

#1 (Most Suitable): 54-year-old Senior Software Engineer at Google
- Mature age with stable employment
- Highest bank account balance (70,000 CHF)
- Comprehensive own funds portfolio
- Domestic/partnered household
- No debt collection cases

#2: 42-year-old Head of Communications & Marketing at Swiss Red Cross
- Mid-career professional
- Stable employment
- Solid own funds composition
- Single status
- No debt collection cases

#3: 30-year-old Auditor at KPMG
- Young professional
- Lowest bank account balance
- Highest 2nd pillar balance
- Early career stage
- No debt collection cases

#4 (Least Suitable): 64-year-old Architect & Project Manager at Herzog & de Meuron
- Near retirement age
- Lowest bank account balance
- Close to typical retirement age
- Potential shorter active income period
- No debt collection cases

Ranking considers age, employment stability, own funds composition, and potential future income trajectory.
